page.title: 01Bickerton Hills & Environs
page.content: Designated an area of outstanding natural beauty. Sandstone range of hills - lowland heath - rise from Cheshire Plain to height of 227m. Attracts many walkers. Signposted 'sandstone trail'. Remains of Mardins Castle. Ironage earthwork fortress. Panoramic views to Merseyside. Jodrell Bank, Mow Cop, Wrekin (Shropshire) and North Wales mountains. Bickerton Institute - village hall hired for private functions. WI, Over 60's Club, WRVS prepare meals-on-wheels. Billiards, pool, tennis. Parish Church, Cemetery, Primary school. Telephone kiosk, bus service Chester Whitchurch serveral times a day. Remains of coppermines at Gallantey Bank. Egerton - water pumping station Vyrnway to Liverpool line. Elects three councillors to joint parish council.
